newsitem.title: BELGIUM: WALIBI'S MINI-EUROPE SEES GOOD SUMMER VISITOR FLOW.
newsitem.headline: WALIBI'S MINI-EUROPE SEES GOOD SUMMER VISITOR FLOW.

text.p: Walibi Group's Mini-Europe theme park in Brussels Bruparck is experiencing a good flow of summer visitors and expects larger attendance than last year, managing director Thierry Meeus said on Wednesday.
"This year is a good year for us," Meeus told Reuters. "The season is not finished but I hope to reach a little more than 300,000 (visitors) this year."
Attendance was a little below 300,000 in 1995, he said.

The park would expand its exhibits next year with a model of the Austrian city of Melk, donated by the government of Lower Austria. Countries and regions had begun donating models to Mini-Europe a few years ago, Meeus said.
